intro: Solanum hoopesii, commonly known as the Hoopes's nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Solanum hoopesii is considered a rare and endangered species.
